item.title: What To Do With Dark Iron Residue in WoW SoD
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Is Dark Iron Residue In WoW SoD?
  • How To Use Dark Iron Residue In WoW SoD

World of Warcraft Classic is full of interesting things that keep players coming back, even when it is a remake of an extremely popular game. However, with the latest seasonal event, Season of Discovery, players are able to collect some new items and currencies that can tremendously help players as they traverse Phase 4 of the season and work toward maxing their character's level out at level 60.

One type of item that players may find themselves with a lot of is the Dark Iron Residue item, which can have 100 of these in a stack, making it an item you can have a lot of. While the item is super useful in the game, the game doesn't really give players very good instructions on where or how to use them. Here's a guide to help you figure out where to use the item and how it works in the game.

What Is Dark Iron Residue In WoW SoD?

Dark Iron Residue is an item dropped by many different enemies within the Blackrock Depths dungeon, which has been added in Phase 4 of the Season of Discovery. Players can carry up to 100 of these in one stack and can collect them from most enemies within Blackrock Depths, including the bosses. Additionally, players who find the CHest of the Seven within Blackrock Depths also have a chance of obtaining the item from it. While there isn't a large chance of obtaining it, since so many enemies drop it, there is a good chance of finding a decent amount during a run of the dungeon.

How To Use Dark Iron Residue In WoW SoD

The Dark Iron Residue is actually an item that can be exchanged for reputation with the Thorium Brotherhood, a group that was notoriously hard to build a reputation with during vanilla WoW. When combining these items with the Blackrock Eruption Event, it is much easier to obtain a higher reputation with the group. To trade them in for reputation, players must go to Master Smith Burninate in Thorium Point and trade him 4 Dark Iron Residue for 15 points with the faction.

In order to trade the Dark Iron Residue into Master Smith Burninate, players must first complete all the quests in the zone, making this a difficult way to obtain reputation. Trading Fiery Cores or Lava Cores to Lokhtos Darkbargainer ( where players trade in their Firelands Embe r) is a faster way to gain reputation.

item.title: Pokemon Sleep Reveals Helpful New Item Coming to the Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon Sleep introduces the Good-Night Ribbon for boosts and bonuses based on hours slept with a Pokemon.
  • The Ribbon's bonuses increase as Pokemon sleep more, with benefits like carry limit boosts and faster evolution.
  • To reach the highest ribbon level, players must consistently sleep with the same Pokemon for 250 nights.

Pokemon Sleep is introducing a new item called the Good-Night Ribbon that will provide helpful boosts and bonuses to any Pokemon it's awarded to. The item will be added in an upcoming update, but Pokemon Sleep has already provided details on how it will work.

Pokemon Sleep had an extremely successful first year financially, and it seems the title is working to maintain that momentum going into its second. As a much more passive app than Pokemon GO , players' main goal is to have the best night sleep possible to attract new Pokemon and gain tasty ingredients for their camp's Snorlax. Pokemon Sleep will now be adding a new feature that benefits the Pokemon fans snooze with the most.

Pokemon Sleep 's new Good-Night Ribbon will be awarded to Pokemon based on how long they've slept beside the player. Starting at 200 hours of sleep shared with a single Pokemon, the Good-Night Ribbon will be added to a Pokemon's profile and start conveying bonuses. The bonuses start out with increasing the Pokemon's carry limit, and if the Pokemon can still evolve, it will also get a bonus to its helping speed. At the third tier level, players will also unlock a special profile icon of the awarded Pokemon. The new feature will launch in August.

The Pokemon bonuses stack, so every tier reached will add extra benefits to the Pokemon. For example, a Pokemon that reaches Ribbon level 3 will be able to carry six more items than a similar Pokemon who has no ribbons. The Ribbons are also intended to help compensate for shortcomings with baby Pokemon and other pre-evolutionary forms, as they tend to be slower and carry less than their evolved counterparts. A charming video trailer imagines Pokemon Sleep's new Good-Night Ribbon as being an extension of celebrating a favorite Pokemon as a child.

Pokemon Sleep Good-Night Ribbon Effects

• Ribbon level 1 : 200 hours of sleeping time shared

• Carry limit +1

• Ribbon level 2 : 500 hours of sleeping time shared

• Carry limit +2

• If the Pokémon can still evolve once (example: Pikachu), its helping frequency is shortened by 5%

• If the Pokémon can still evolve twice (example: Pichu), its helping frequency is shortened by 11%

• Ribbon level 3 : 1,000 hours of sleeping time shared

• Carry limit +3

• Special profile icon of that helper Pokémon

• Ribbon level 4 : 2,000 hours of sleeping time shared

• Carry limit +2

• If the Pokémon can still evolve once (example: Pikachu), its helping frequency is shortened by 7% (for a total of 12% shorter)

• If the Pokémon can still evolve twice (example: Pichu), its helping frequency is shortened by 14% (for a total of 25% shorter)

It's worth noting that in order to achieve the final ribbon level, players would need to get eight hours of sleep consistently for 250 nights, all while keeping the same helper Pokemon in the party. Rotating helper Pokemon to increase their levels and to take advantage of the types of ingredients they bring and the type of help they provide is useful, so getting a Pokemon to max ribbon level could be an arduous feat.

However, for Pokemon Sleep fans who love keeping a favorite Pokemon in their group, this will be a cute and passive way to celebrate their favorite and gain some perks as a bonus.

item.title: Skyrim: The 27 Best Husbands In The Game (& How To Marry Them)
item.description:
Highlights

  • Gamers can settle down in Skyrim by marrying a variety of male characters, each with unique quests and perks to offer as spouses.
  • From blacksmiths to mercenaries, players can choose from a diverse selection of potential husbands throughout the vast world of Skyrim.
  • One must obtain an Amulet of Mara and complete specific quests to unlock the option to marry characters like Octieve San or Vilkas in the game.

If players are looking to finally settle down and find love in The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim , they might be a bit surprised by how many options they have to choose from. So long as they have the Amulet of Mara, pretty much anyone whose trust they have gained will be willing to get married to the Dragonborn and settle down.

While who the player settles down with is a personal choice, there are a few husbands in particular that are recommended picks as the Dragonborn's life-long partner. The best husbands in Skyrim are fun to interact with and boast great combat abilities that make them reliable followers. The marriage system in Skyrim may feel rather threadbare, but players won't mind as long as they get to interact with Skyrim 's male marriage options and interact with the best of the bunch.

Updated on July 22, 2024, by Ritwik Mitra: The best part about Skyrim is the sheer amount of content that will keep players coming back for more. Even without mods, players can easily sink in north of a hundred hours as they explore this massive world, checking every nook and cranny as they uncover a wealth of secrets. One of the more interesting things to do in Skyrim is to find a partner to marry after helping them out in some form or another. Players who are seeking out one of Skyrim's male marriage options will find themselves spoiled for choice, but some husbands are arguably better than others.

How To Get Married In Skyrim

The first step to getting married in Skyrim is to speak with Maramal in Riften . When players first enter the city, they can find him preaching at the Bee and Barb Inn. He can be approached for some additional information about the Temple of Mara. After finishing the conversation, the Dragonborn can get married in the temple.

On top of Maramal's blessing, an Amulet of Mara is required as well. The Amulet of Mara can be purchased from Maramal as well, though it will cost 200 gold. Alternatively, it can be found pretty commonly in random loot or received as a reward at the end of the Book of Love quest from Dinya Balu. Dinya is a quest-giver found at the Temple of Mara in Riften.

27 Octieve San

Requirement: Help Him Pay Off His Debts

  • Location: Usually near the Winking Skeever in Solitude
  • Related Quest: None

There's something about helping out a man down on his luck that will entice any player to try and aid someone. Such is the case with Octieve San, a man who is insecure about his age and drowns out his worries with alcohol. However, things don't stop here — he also gambles heavily to the point of racking up a huge debt and putting himself in harm's way.

Thankfully, the altruism of the Dragonborn can help him pay off his debts, allowing him to repay the favor by teaching players how to wield a two-handed weapon properly. If players form a bond with this character while performing this simple act of kindness, then they can also go the extra mile and marry him, which makes for an interesting Skyrim male marriage option .

26 Cosnach

Requirement: Defeat Him In A Brawl

  • Location: The Silver-Blood Inn, Markarth
  • Related Quest: None

Lack of work can send people down a dark path, and such is the case with Cosnach. This character is up for any task that is asked of him, but his job as a porter isn't all that taxing and leaves him with a lot of free time. So, it's no surprise that he can usually be found ingesting a ton of alcohol in the Silver-Blood Inn.

Given his need for gold, he can be goaded into a brawl where the winner earns 100 gold. If players beat him to a pulp, then they will have somehow gained his approval and can ask if he wants to marry them. It's an odd way to tie the knot with one of Skyrim 's male marriage options , but events like these just add to the enduring charm of the game.

25 Wilhelm

Requirement: Complete "Lifting The Shroud"

  • Location: The Vilemyr Inn, Ivarstead
  • Related Quest: Lifting the Shroud

Wilhelm is an innkeeper who is pretty engaging to talk to, giving the quest Lifting the Shroud if the player asks for any information. This allows players to explore Shroud Hearth Barrow, which is a pretty unique dungeon in the game.

Completing this quest leads to Wilhelm being unlocked as a potential romance option. He's a pretty normal guy and a fun person to end up with if the player wants a marriage with an innkeeper who knows what's what.

24 Sorex Vinius

Requirement: Deliver Stros M'Kai Rum To Falk Firebeard At The Blue Palace

  • Location: The Winking Skeever, Solitude
  • Related Quest: None

A merchant from Solitude who works at the Winking Skeever, Sorex Vinius has some great stories of his own that players can hear if they interact with him. Marrying him is a pretty simple affair, which may turn some people off the idea of ending up with him.

He will ask the player to deliver Stros M'Kai Rum kegs to Falk Firebeard at Blue Palace. Aside from earning money, the Dragonborn also forms a bond with Sorex Vinius for completing this menial task that can lead to a flourishing marriage.

23 Gat Gro-Shargakh

Requirement: Liberate Kolskeggr Mine

  • Location: Kolskeggr Mine, The Reach
  • Related Quest: None

Kolskeggr Mine is an area that is overrun by the Forsworn, and players are given a task by Pavo Attius to liberate the mine. The Forsworn are tough opponents but should be easy pickings for the player if they've spent their fair share of time exploring the world and leveling up.

Liberating the mine causes one of the miners, Gat Gro-Shargakh, to become fond of the player. Marrying him allows players to get some profits from his shop, although gamers should always try to empty the cave of any Forsworn whenever they happen to respawn.

22 Filnjar

Requirement: Complete "Mine Or Yours"

  • Location: Shor's Stone, The Rift
  • Related Quest: Mine or Yours

It seems that clearing mines of enemies is a great way to attain a hand in marriage. Such is the case with Filnjar, the blacksmith of Shor's Stone, who asks the player to clear Redbelly Mine of frostbite spiders.

Being married to a blacksmith is certainly convenient for players who want to repair their weapons properly without having to invest points in the same. Filnjar is a pretty rugged husband that players should seek out if they are fond of smithing.

21 Sondas Drenim

Requirement: Deliver His Note To Quintus Navale

  • Location: Goldenrock Mine, Darkwater Crossing.
  • Related Quest: None

The idea of doing a Radiant Quest to gain a possible husband may sound like a cheap way to marry someone. However, for what it's worth, players who want to marry a Dunmer can do so by fulfilling a favor for Sondas Dremin.

All they have to do is take his note and deliver it to Quintus Navale. Doing this ensures that players can ask for Sondas' hand in marriage if they wish, though he is far from the best husband in Skyrim .

20 Athis

Requirement: Complete "Glory of the Dead"

  • Location: Jorrvaskr, Whiterun
  • Related Quest: Glory Of The Dead (must join Companions)

It's a rarity to see a Dunmer in a warrior faction like the Companions, but Athis is living proof of the fact that it can happen. He's the only Dunmer in the Companions and is seen engaging in a brawl as soon as the Dragonborn enters Jorrvaskr for the first time.

Athis, like most regular Companion followers, is a great option as a follower for the first 25 levels of the game. The bonus of having him as a spouse is that he provides One-Handed skill training. To marry him, the player needs to finish the Companion quest line fully and become the Harbinger.

19 Belrand

Requirement: Hire For 500 Gold

  • Location: Winking Skeever, Solitude
  • Related Quest: None

Belrand might not be the best-looking spouse in the game, but he makes up for it with his level cap of 40. He'll serve the Dragonborn well for these first 40 levels and is particularly resilient since he uses a combination of spells and sword skills to outwit his enemies.

Belrand also shows a rare degree of personality through his dialogue and commentary, making him great company. To marry him, he needs to be hired for 500 gold as a mercenary. After that, he can be married if players have the Amulet of Mara.

18 Gregor

Requirement: Complete "Thane Of The Pale"

  • Location: Dawnstar
  • Related Quest: Become Thane of the Pale (requires the Hearthfire DLC)

Gregor is another housecarl in the game, and his specialty lies mostly in Heavy Armor and One-Handed combat skills. In order to recruit him and eventually marry him, the Dragonborn should become the Thane of the Pale by running jobs for the Jarl in Dawnstar.

Gregor is a strong one as a spouse. His level cap is at 50, so he'll last the player for ideally half of their game or more, depending on how long it takes them to complete all quests and DLC in Skyrim . He's a great choice, even if he's just a simple housecarl and might lack a bit of personality.

17 Halbarn Iron-Fur

Requirement: Complete "Retaking Thirsk" And "Halbarn's Supplies"

  • Location: Solstheim
  • Related Quests: Retaking Thirsk, followed by Halbarn's Supplies (requires the Dragonborn DLC)

Players can travel to Solstheim to meet Halbarn Iron-Fur, a spouse who won't disappoint. He's extremely strong and knowledgeable about all things blacksmithing. In fact, once all quests related to him are done, he becomes a pretty decent merchant to visit regularly.

Halbarn can also be married, but this requires two entire quests to be completed. The Thirsk must be retaken from the rieklings, after which he requires the Dragonborn to get him 10 stalhrim ingots and 15 ebony ingots. It's all worth it, however, since his level cap is extremely high at 60.

16 Calder

Requirement: Complete "Thane Of Eastmarch"

  • Location: Hjerim, Windhelm
  • Related Quest: Become The Thane Of Eastmarch

Calder is another housecarl in the game, and while housecarls can seem a little lifeless and boring, he has a pretty unique appearance compared to so many other housecarls and human NPCs in the game, which significantly sets him apart.

Calder's level is capped at 50 in true housecarl fashion, so he'll serve as a follower and spouse for just over the first half of the game. He's not the easiest housecarl to get, however, since achieving Thane status involves rubbing elbows with Ulfric (if the Civil War questline hasn't been resolved), buying Hjerim (one of the more expensive homes in Skyrim ), and doing several minor quests around Windhelm. Only the player can decide if he's worth all that effort.

15 Scouts-Many-Marshes

Requirement: Talk To Torbjorn Shatter-Shield About The Argonian Dock Workers

  • Location: Windhelm Docks
  • Related Quest: Argonian Dock Workers

There aren't that many husbands in Skyrim that are Argonians, but even among the few, Scouts-Many-Marshes takes the spot as the best one. He's very much a peace-loving character, and he can be found outside of Windhelm, right by the river.

He's a blacksmith by trade, but he can't be hired as a follower as he's only level 4 and has the blacksmith character type. However, what does make him valuable is the fact that he can offer training in the Light Armor skill, so players who specialize in this category might find him a particularly useful spouse to have. After speaking to him for the first time and helping him with a quest, he can be asked to marry the Dragonborn.

14 Stenvar

Requirement: Hire For 500 Gold

  • Location: Candlehearth Hall, Windhelm
  • Related Quest: None

Looking for a spouse who's not afraid of a fight? Head over to Windhelm's Candlehearth Hall. In the upstairs area at the last table, the Dragonborn will be able to find an old and seasoned mercenary named Stenvar, who can be hired for 500 coins.

He has a decent level cap of 40, so he'll serve the Dragonborn well as a follower and spouse for the first 40 levels of the game. After that, he's best left at home to tend to the shop. The cool part is that he can also become a member of the Blades if invited, and no special quest is needed to marry him.

13 Marcurio

Requirement: Hire For 500 Gold

  • Location: Bee and Barb, Riften
  • Related Quest: None

Not many capable mages want to devote their life to a spouse, but Marcurio is the exception to this rule. He can be found at the Bee and Barb Inn over at Riften, and he'll often be sitting on the first-floor bench, on the left side of the bar counter. He's a mercenary with a hiring price of 500 coins.

Marcurio's level cap is decent as well, and he'll level until 40 with the Dragonborn, making him a fairly strong follower in the first half of the game. He can join the Blades and is well versed in the school of Destruction magic, making him a great damage dealer but squishy when paired with another ranged fighter.

12 Vorstag

Requirement: Hire For 500 Gold

  • Location: Silver-Blood Inn, Markarth
  • Related Quest: None

Vorstag is another mercenary found in Skyrim . His home is the Silver-Blood Inn over in Markarth, and he can be easily recognized by his Nordic armor and flashy war paint. Vorstag has a typical hiring rate of 500 gold coins, similar to all the other mercenaries in the game.

His level will also get capped at 40, which means that, towards higher levels, he's usually best left at home rather than traveled with. Vorstag can be married almost instantly without doing any quests, and like many of the mercenaries, he's also a candidate for joining the Blades. His warrior character type makes him a pretty decent follower for any ranged character, as he specializes in heavy armor.

11 Torvar

Requirement: Complete "Glory Of The Dead"

  • Location: Jorrvaskr, Whiterun
  • Related Quest: Glory Of The Dead (must join the Companions)

Torvar is not the easiest one to deal with. A member of the Companions, he's initially quite nice but becomes a tad jealous as the Dragonborn surpasses him in the ranks of the guild. That being said, he can be married once the Companions' quest Glory of the Dead has been completed.

Torvar is a typical Nord warrior. He's skilled in one-handed, despite his love for two-handed weapons like hammers and axes. Above all, Torvar is a lover of all things alcoholic and will often talk about drinking and getting drunk. But hey, for some Dragonborns, he just might be the one and only.

10 Revyn Sadri

Requirement: Find Viola's Gold Ring

  • Location: Gray Quarter, Windhelm
  • Related Quest: That Was Always There

Head over to Windhelm's Gray Quarter, an area where Dunmer live in poverty and separation from the rest of Windhelm's citizens. Players will find Revyn's shop there and discover that he's a hardworking and principled salesman who dislikes thieves.

In fact, he dislikes thieves so much that he'll give players the task of returning a golden ring to Viola Giordano since he thinks it's a stolen item. If the player stealthily returns the ring, he will be available for marriage and will reward them with some Speech training, but if the player hands Viola the ring face to face, Revyn's shop will face higher taxation, and he will dislike the Dragonborn for it.

9 Roggi Knot-Beard

Requirement: Find His Ancestral Shield

  • Location: Steamscorch Mine or Braidwood Inn, Kynesgrove
  • Related Quest: Fing Roggi Knot-Beard's Ancestral Shield

There's nothing tremendously special about Roggi, but he's a hardworking and honest man. Players can find him at Kynesgrove, working at the Steamscorch Mine and occasionally at Braidwood Inn at nighttime.

Upon meeting him, he'll share a fascinating story about how an ancestor of his founded Kynesgrove but met an unfortunate fate inside a cave and lost his shield. Roggi will then send players off to find this fabled ancestral shield and return it to him, after which he'll be available as a marriage candidate.

8 Ghorbash The Iron Hand

Requirement: Pay His Dowry Or Persuade Him To Leave

  • Location: Dushnik Yal
  • Related Quest: None

Should the player wish to marry an orc, that's possible, too. Travel to the Orc Stronghold of Dushnik Yal near Markarth, and the player will be introduced to Ghorbash there. He's a former exile of his kind, but he misses adventuring out into the wild.

However, since orcs usually cannot leave their people as that would dishonor them, he needs to be persuaded in order to be taken along for the journey. Alternatively, players can brawl with him, and if they win, he'll come along as a follower, after which players can marry him.

item.title: 8 Horror Games With The Best Character Customization
item.description:
Highlights

  • Horror games often limit player input, but titles like Vampire: The Masquerade allow for character customization and choice in gameplay.
  • Resident Evil 4's customization options go beyond typical horror games, offering players the ability to dress up characters and change outfits.
  • Dead by Daylight sets itself apart with a vast array of cosmetics and crossovers, allowing for unmatched character customization in the horror genre.

Horror games normally follow a more linear structure than other genres. A pre-written, pre-designed protagonist will follow the plot, with perhaps a few branching paths for collectibles or optional scares, but very little room for player input. This is true both in terms of gameplay and the character that players will play as.

Not all games are made equal though, and there are horror games that give the players a bit of freedom to determine what character they are going to guide through the onslaught of horrors. In most cases, it will just be a matter of playing with the characters' wardrobe, but there are a very few select titles that go the extra mile.

8 Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines

Players Determine What Kind of Vampire They Want to Be

Based on the TTRPG all about political and personal horror, Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines gave fans the chance to experience the pen and paper RPG in video game format. They start the game as a recently-embraced vampire in the city of Los Angeles, where tensions between the two rival sects, the Camarilla and the Anarchs, are simmering below the surface. In order to prove they were deserving of the clemency the Prince of the city showed them, players have to complete a number of tasks, with most centering around a mysterious sarcophagus.

Just as a TTRPG would do, players choose their gender and clan, which in turn determines what disciplines they have access to. Though they cannot change their character's appearance, they can change their attire by equipping armor found throughout the game, as well as spending points to increase attributes, skills, and disciplines.

7 Resident Evil 4

The Remake Allows Players To Dress Up Leon And Ashley

Playing as the famed Resident Evil protagonist Leon S. Kennedy on an onerous mission to rescue the President's daughter from the clutches of a cult, one would think there isn't any room for customization, what with a protagonist that is already fully designed and an extremely linear plot, but this is where Resident Evil 4 separates itself from other single-player horror games.

Rather than rocking the vanilla Leon and Ashley outfits, players who pre-ordered the game, or who purchase the right DLC, can dress up Leon and Ashley in their casual or romantic outfits, with bonus hero and villain skins for Leon. Other outfits can be unlocked by completing the game with a certain ranking.

6 Fallen London

The Freedom To Choose One Of Many Faces And Fates

One would not think a free-to-play browser game would offer much in terms of customization or horror, but Fallen London might just surprise them. Set in an alternate version of Victorian London, most of the city has sunk beneath the ground into large caverns, all centered around a strange bazaar, with many peculiar occurrences that belay subtle horror with its skillful writing.

Players can choose an avatar for themselves from one of the many on offer, and with enough in-game currency, they can even change their face at their leisure. By playing the game, they can change the course of their character's story, and change their attributes. For a free game, players can drop just a few minutes in here and there, and it is surprisingly detailed.

5 Content Warning

Players Can Set Themselves Apart By Customizing Their Face

Content Warning is a fun new horror game where a group of friends armed with a camera try to make themselves go viral through recording some scary videos. How do they get the frightening footage? By recording some very real and very frightening creatures that lurk in the dark, cavernous underground place called The Old World. Players can then watch their recordings in-game, as the game itself captures gameplay and audio.

The players themselves play avatars dressed in what looks like old-school diving gear, but they are able to change their faces to tell each other apart. They can customize the colors of their suit, and use letters to spell out words or use symbols to make emojis. There are ways to make an even more unique face via the game files for those who are tech-savvy, opening up even more customization options.

4 Lethal Company

Mods Allow Players To Cosplay As Famous Characters

Another excellent multiplayer horror game, Lethal Company tasks up to four unlucky employees with embarking on dangerous missions to alien planets and recovering as much scrap as they can before dying from the dangerous conditions, hostile monsters, or when the ship engages its autopilot and flies off at midnight, leaving any not onboard stranded.

Working for the company and exploring space, it makes sense that employees would have to wear a uniform, which in this case is an orange hazmat suit. This can cause players to confuse each other, especially if they have to go radio-silent to avoid a monster hearing them. Thankfully, players can purchase alternate suits using in-game currency for more unique looks, but for those saving their credits, there are always mods that can deck them out in suits based around Kirby, Mario, Knuckles, or even a Minion.

3 Bloodborne

In Typical Soulsborne Fashion, Players Can Customize Their Hunter

FromSoftware leaned into their ability to craft terrifying monsters and set pieces when developing Bloodborne , a gothic horror masterpiece heavy with Victorian undertones. The city of Yharnam has been gripped by a disease passed on through blood that transforms ordinary people into terrifying creatures, and it is up to the player to find the cause, and put an end to it. Along the way, their courage will be tested as they face beasts that are as horrific as they are deadly.

Before they set off on their onerous quest, though, they will need to create their character, determining their gender, overall appearance (down to details such as hairstyle and eye color), as well as their origin class, which will determine what skills they start off with, and what style of combat they should focus on.

2 The Outlast Trials

Customize Characters' Gender And Appearance

Starting off its career as a single-player horror experience, Outlast eventually branched out into the world of multiplayer horror, resulting in The Outlast Trials . Murkoff are back at their old tricks, asking for 'volunteers' to be their lab rats for brainwashing experiments. They will be subjected to dangerous and terrifying trials that will test the limits of their will and courage. Players are free to brave it alone, or choose to believe in safety in numbers.

Just one more change between the original Outlast is that players aren't confined to a pre-designed character, and instead will create their own. They can choose their gender, pick between the many face presets, deck their character out in new clothes unlocked as they play, and even purchase decor for their room. They can also customize what skills their character can take into the trials, called Rigs, adding RPG elements to this horror experience.

1 Dead By Daylight

An Unparalleled Amount Of Cosmetics

The most popular asymmetrical horror game currently on the market is Dead by Daylight . Other games have tried to capitalize on its success, such as V/H/S , Friday the 13th, and Killer Klowns from Outer Space , but no game has managed to offer any real competition, even those based on legendary IPs. One of the secrets to its success is the number of crossovers, bringing in characters from famous games and movies such as Resident Evil , Tomb Raider , Halloween , Alien , and even Dungeons and Dragons .

Alongside a roster brimming with licensed characters, there are also countless original ones with different appearances, backgrounds, perks, and outfits, BHVR is constantly creating new cosmetics to deck them out with. The amount of clothes available for characters is impressive and unmatched by any other game. Players could easily spend as much time dressing their characters up as hunting or being hunted in the trials.

item.title: Former Rockstar Games Dev Comments on Grand Theft Auto 6
item.description:
Highlights

  • GTA 6 may not be drastically different from GTA 5 due to limited hardware upgrades, according to former Rockstar dev Vermeij.
  • Despite this, Vermeij still has high hopes for GTA 6, praising the game and its return to the Miami-inspired Vice City setting.
  • Fans eagerly await more updates on GTA 6, with expectations high for a new trailer release before the game's 2025 launch date.

Ex-Rockstar Games dev Obbe Vermeij has revealed his thoughts on Grand Theft Auto 6 , stating how it may not be too different from its predecessor. Grand Theft Auto 6 is currently in development for PS5 and Xbox Series X/S, with a 2025 launch in sight.

The highly successful GTA franchise is set to receive its first mainline game in over a decade as GTA 6 rolls out next year. In December 2023, publisher Rockstar Games unveiled GTA 6 's debut trailer, which raced to over 200 million views on YouTube. Since then, information about the open-world game has been rather scarce, fueling anticipation among fans. Recently, Vermeij, a former Rockstar North employee who worked on multiple GTA titles like GTA: San Andreas and GTA 4 , talked about the next entry in the crime saga.

In an interview with SanInPlay, Obbe Vermeij said that he doesn't think GTA 6 will be "wildly different" compared to GTA 5 , suggesting that some fans may want to temper their expectations. He based this claim on the relatively small upgrade in hardware power that has taken place since the previous console generation. The Rockstar Games alumnus underlined how the transition from PS1 to PS2 was "enormous" while the transition from PS4 to PS5 was "not that big," stating that the devs don't have the "technology jump" needed to make things "different and better."

Ex-Rockstar Games Dev Still Has High Hopes for GTA 6

Despite not expecting a big change compared to the previous game, Vermeij admitted that Rockstar Games have "taken it even further" with GTA 6 . He said that it will still be "the best game out there." Revealing what impressed him in the trailer, he said that the scene that "blows me away" is the one that shows a beach filled with a number of different characters, each doing something of their own. Further, the former GTA developer shared his approval of the series returning to Miami-inspired Vice City, saying that he loves the "Miami vibe." He added that he is looking forward to GTA 6 and will certainly play it.

With just a single official reveal so far, the GTA 6 trailer continues to be popular among fans eagerly waiting for the next update from Rockstar Games. Keeping in mind that the game is scheduled to arrive sometime in 2025, there are high chances that the next GTA 6 trailer may be revealed before the year ends. Whenever that happens, it seems safe to say that the forthcoming trailer will likely receive a similar response as the first one.
